moves.1. d4: A fairly short game though I can't help but feel it could have been a little shorter, any insights would be gratefully received
moves.1... d5 2. c4 Nf6: QGD Marshall Defence, not one I have seen all that often.
moves.3. Nf3 Bg4 4. Ne5: Not a move I have played often but I like the knight here as it can be hard to shift
moves.4... Be6: Blocks the e pawn and limits blacks dsb, so he is pretty much forced to fianchetto it
moves.5. Nc3 dxc4 6. e4 Nfd7 7. Nxc4 Bxc4: Possibly not the best move from black as I can now develop with tempo and black loses his most oactive piece
moves.8. Bxc4 e6 9. O-O g6 10. Qf3 Bg7 11. e5: I have a good grip on the light squares, particularly those in the centre, so I wasn't too worried about this move, it also allows Ne4
moves.11... O-O: Castling into potential danger, as some of my pieces are already pointing that way
moves.12. Bf4 c6: I don't understand this move at all as it means blacks b8 knight can only move to a6 where it is no better off than it is now.
moves.13. Ne4: I found this irresistable after blacks previous move
moves.13... f5: Loses a pawn and also will give me a passed pawn.
moves.15... Nb6: Another strange move from black, I can't see what this achieves other than allowing the Nb8 to go to d7
moves.16. Qh3: Threatening mate with Qxh7 means that black has to allow me the Royal fork gaining me a rook for a knight
moves.16... h5: About the only option I could see that worked for black,  16...,h6, Nf7+ piles pressure on h6
moves.17. Nf7+ Rxf7 18. Bxf7: To my mind I was clearly ahead here however I couldn't see a clear win
moves.18... Qe7 19. Bxg6: Also tempting was e6 but I felt this was better as it restricts the black king to the 8th rank
moves.20. Qxh5+ Kg8 21. Bg5: pushing the black queen away from defence of the bishop, Qf8 loses to Qh7#
moves.21... Qe6 22. Qh7+ Kf8 23. Bxf5: I wasn't thrilled with this move but couldn't see anything better
moves.23... Qd5 24. e6: restricting the black king still to the 8th rank
moves.24... Nf6: This is a blunder from black as we will see
moves.25. Bxf6:
the bishop on f6 is immune due to Qf7#. 

Black resigned

Thanks for reading please comment
